intro: Ruschia strubeniae, commonly known as the Strobilifera Ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces striking, showy flowers in shades of pink and purple, which bloom during the summer months. Its fleshy, blue-green leaves are covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Ruschia strubeniae is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
